
The state rankings were created by aggregating the hospital ratings for each state and ordering the states from best to worst.  I also included a "variability",
which is the standard error around the mean for each state, along with the average score to provide a sense of whether or not the difference between the states were significant 
(typically not).  

Similar to the rankig of best hospitals list, I'm fairly comfortable that this aggregate score approach is a good one.  By considering four distinct areas of 
healthcare and aggregating them together, the luck should even out and a "wisdom of the masses" effect should provide an unbiased total score.

Here were the top 10...
